33000000.name: Glintstone Staff
33000000.caption:
Staff with a glintstone embedded at the tip. A catalyst for casting sorceries.

Sorceries must be memorized first at a site of lost grace, and a staff must be equipped to cast them.

33040000.name: Crystal Staff
33040000.caption:
Staff fashioned from pure crystal; a deed impossible for a human. Enhances Crystalian sorceries.

The Crystalian's faint cogitation is known as the "wisdom of stone." This staff can only be wielded by those of intellect high enough to grasp such wisdom.

33050000.name: Gelmir Glintstone Staff
33050000.caption:
Staff with a forked tip, embedded with red glintstones. Enhances lava sorceries.

The Man-Serpents of Mt. Gelmir draw from faith in addition to intelligence to enhance the potency of their sorcery.

33060000.name: Demi-Human Queen's Staff
33060000.caption:
Glintstone staff styled as a scepter. A gift once given to the demi-humans to foster peace, it can be wielded even by those of low intelligence.

Sneered at by fools in the academy.

33090000.name: Carian Regal Scepter
33090000.caption:
Magic scepter of Rennala, Queen of the Full Moon. The glintstone is known as a Carian Blue, enhancing full moon sorceries.

Only those of the highest intelligence may wield this, the finest of all glintstone staves.

33120000.name: Digger's Staff
33120000.caption:
Staff of a sorcerer-miner who extracts glintstone from crystal tunnels. The staff itself is a tool used to mine, and the ferrule is also embedded with a glintstone.

Boosts the power of Stonedigger sorceries.

33130000.name: Astrologer's Staff
33130000.caption:
Staff of the astrologers. A glintstone is embedded in the tip, enabling it to be used a catalyst for sorceries.

Sorceries must be memorized first at a site of lost grace, and a staff must be equipped to cast them.

33170000.name: Carian Glintblade Staff
33170000.caption:
Staff embedded with a blue glintstone. One of two types of Carian staff.

Gifted to enchanted knights, it enhances Glintblade sorceries.

33180000.name: Prince of Death's Staff
33180000.caption:
Staff embedded with sullied amber, said to be a very part of the Prince of Death. Enhances death sorceries.

One of the staves deemed heretical by the academy for its ability to allow sorceries to be augmented through faith in addition to intelligence.

33190000.name: Albinauric Staff
33190000.caption:
Short staff with a blue glintstone embedded. Wielded by the Albinaurics of old.

The Albinaurics harbor a secret; they cast sorcery using their innate arcaneness.

33200000.name: Academy Glintstone Staff
33200000.caption:
Staff of the Academy of Raya Lucaria, embedded with a turquoise glintstone.

Only a recognized sorcerer is permitted to wield this staff.

33210000.name: Carian Glintstone Staff
33210000.caption:
Staff embedded with a blue glintstone. One of two types of Carian staff.

Given to sorcerers that they might enact the role of knight. Enhances Carian sword sorceries.

33230000.name: Azur's Glintstone Staff
33230000.caption:
Staff of the primeval glintstone sorcerer Azur. Only those who have glimpsed what lies beyond the wisdom of stone may wield it.

Reduces casting time of all sorceries, but consumes additional FP.

33240000.name: Lusat's Glintstone Staff
33240000.caption:
Staff of the primeval glintstone sorcerer Lusat. Only those who have glimpsed what lies beyond the wisdom of stone may wield it.

Enhances power of all sorceries, but consumes additional FP.

33250000.name: Meteorite Staff
33250000.caption:
Staff embedded with a dark purple glintstone, said to be the fragment of a meteorite. Boasts high sorcery scaling and boosts gravity sorceries as well.

However, this staff cannot be strengthened in any way.

33260000.name: Staff of the Guilty
33260000.caption:
A heretical staff fashioned from a smoldering, withered sapling that turns the blood of sacrifices pierced by it into glintstone. Similar to hex magic.

Sorceries are scaled with faith rather than intelligence when wielding this staff which enhances thorn sorceries in particular.

33270000.name: Rotten Crystal Staff
33270000.caption:
Staff fashioned from pure crystal; a deed impossible for a human. It festers with scarlet rot.

Enhances Crystalian sorceries.

33280000.name: Staff of Loss
33280000.caption:
Staff missing its glintstone. Wielded by sorcerers who believe that discovery comes through acts of asceticism.

This staff is only capable of casting invisibility sorceries, but that is reason enough for some to wield it.

34000000.name: Finger Seal
34000000.caption:
A sacred seal bestowed by Finger Maiden which serves as a catalyst for casting sacred incantations.

Incantations must be memorized first at a site of grace, and a sacred seal must be equipped to cast them.

34010000.name: Godslayer's Seal
34010000.caption:
Sacred seal of the Godskin Apostles, inlaid with obsidian.

Said to represent the manipulation of black flame, this catalyst enhances godslayer incantations.

34020000.name: Giant's Seal
34020000.caption:
Sacred seal depicting the one-eyed god of the Fire Giants, adorned with braids of red hair.

Sacred seal wielded by Fire Monks and Prelates, this catalyst enhances Giants' Flame incantations.

34030000.name: Gravel Stone Seal
34030000.caption:
Sacred seal made from Gravel Stone thought to be an ancient dragon scale. Enhances Dragon Cult incantations of the Royal Capital.

The worship of the ancient dragons does not conflict with belief in the Erdtree. After all, this seal, and lighting itself, are both imbued with gold.

34040000.name: Clawmark Seal
34040000.caption:
Sacred seal granted by Gurranq, the Beast Clergyman. A rare trinket which allows incantations to be scaled with strength.

The claw mark represents Gurranq's wrath. Enhances bestial incantations learned from Gurranq.

34060000.name: Golden Order Seal
34060000.caption:
A formless sacred seal depicting the ceremonial observation of Order. Enhances Golden Order Fundamentalist incantations.

Fundamentalism is scholarship in all but name. Scales incantations using both intelligence and faith.

34070000.name: Erdtree Seal
34070000.caption:
A formless sacred seal decorated with an Erdtree crest, once the focus of religion in the Lands Between.

Even though the Elden Ring is shattered, and the Erdtree has dulled from its former radiance, earnest faith continues to hold the answers.

34080000.name: Dragon Communion Seal
34080000.caption:
Formless drakeblood seal with a dragon communion crest. Enhances Dragon Communion incantations.

The sacrificial devouring of the heart gives power.
Indeed, Dragon Communion is too primal in nature for the term "incantation" to be appropriate.
This seal scales incantations with one's arcane attribute.

34090000.name: Frenzied Flame Seal
34090000.caption:
Formless sacred seal bestowed by the maiden of the Three Fingers. Enhances incantations of the frenzied flame.

This seal is the mark of the Lord of Frenzied Flame. Scales incantations using strength, dexterity, intelligence, and faith all together.

40000000.name: Shortbow
40000000.caption:
Small bow made to fire arrows over great distances. Other than its ability to fire off arrows in rapid succession, it is also well-suited for use on horseback.

To use a bow, arrows must also be equipped.

40010000.name: Misbegotten Shortbow
40010000.caption:
Shortbow wielded by Winged Misbegotten. Fine fur clings to it.

Designed to inflict additional damage by sacrificing range.

40020000.name: Red Branch Shortbow
40020000.caption:
Shortbow of polished red wood. Fashioned by a master craftsman and wielded by pages.

A bow which requires dexterity rather than strength to master.

40030000.name: Harp Bow
40030000.caption:
Bow fashioned from a minstrel's harp. Sonorous tones still resound when firing arrows.

Troubadours sing tales of champions, both in the honorable service of the Erdtree, and the one who spurns honor for blasphemy.

40050000.name: Composite Bow
40050000.caption:
Bow composited from a mix of materials.

Demands high attributes, and is tricky to wield, but is a fearsome tool when mastered.

41000000.name: Longbow
41000000.caption:
Longbow made to fire arrows over great distances. Compared to a shortbow, arrows fired reach further and deal more damage.

To use a bow, arrows must also be equipped.

41010000.name: Albinauric Bow
41010000.caption:
Longbow featuring delicate silverwork. Wielded by Albinauric wolfback archers.

This bow requires dexterity over strength to master.

41020000.name: Horn Bow
41020000.caption:
Longbow made from animal horn. Wielded by the master hunters of the ancestral followers.

Imbues arrows fired with magic damage.
Reveals its true worth when used with magic-infused arrows.

41030000.name: Erdtree Bow
41030000.caption:
Longbow featuring Erdtree styling. In times of old, when faith and battle went hand in hand, this weapon was created in tandem with the Golden Arrow.

Scales all arrow damage with faith, revealing its true worth when used with holy-infused arrows.

41040000.name: Serpent Bow
41040000.caption:
Malformed bow in the shape of a pair of poisonous snakes. Imbues arrows with poison through pagan magic, revealing its true worth when used with poison-infused arrows.

Used by assassins known as the Formless Serpents.

41060000.name: Pulley Bow
41060000.caption:
Longbow which utilizes a series of pulleys and springs. The complex mechanism, which required advanced mathematical and mechanical understanding to craft, was likely made by a certain genius who learned Golden Order fundamentalism.

Enhances precision while shooting, enabling arrows to fly much further distances.

41070000.name: Black Bow
41070000.caption:
Longbow carved from black wood to resemble a blade. One of the most difficult bows to master.

The blade-like body of the bow is light and cuts through the air. Though a longbow, it can be wielded similarly to a shortbow.

42000000.name: Lion Greatbow
42000000.caption:
Greatbow of black iron wielded by General Radahn. Decorated with a lion mane motif.

Imbued with gravitational power of the Starscourge, when used along with Radahn's Spear, it becomes a true weapon of a champion.

42010000.name: Golem Greatbow
42010000.caption:
Greatbow of black stone crafted by a civilization now gone to ruin. Weapon of the Guardian Golem.

Extremely heavy, this greatbow requires enormous strength just to draw, suggesting it was not designed for human use.

42030000.name: Erdtree Greatbow
42030000.caption:
Greatbow featuring Erdtree styling. In times of old, when faith and battle went hand in hand, this weapon was created in tandem with the Golden Great Arrow.

Scales all arrow damage with faith, revealing its true worth when used with holy-infused arrows.

42040000.name: Greatbow
42040000.caption:
Enormous greatbow larger than any man. Can not be drawn with any ordinary level of strength, but the force of its shots is extraordinary.

A greatbow can only fire great arrows.

43000000.name: Soldier's Crossbow
43000000.caption:
A crossbow of simple make, usable by anyone, but lacking in both power and accuracy.

Bolts must be equipped to use a crossbow.

43020000.name: Light Crossbow
43020000.caption:
Ranged weapon made from a bow fixed to a stock. Deals good damage and is simple to use, but requires reloading after firing.

Bolts must be equipped to use a crossbow.

43030000.name: Heavy Crossbow
43030000.caption:
Heavy crossbow with iron limbs, increasing damage dealt.

Commonly employed in the Shattering.

43050000.name: Pulley Crossbow
43050000.caption:
Crossbow made with pulleys and power springs. The complex mechanism, which required advanced mathematical and mechanical understanding to craft, was likely made by a certain genius who learned Golden Order fundamentalism.
One touch fires a volley of bolts. Be warned; large stores of bolts can be quickly spent.

43060000.name: Full Moon Crossbow
43060000.caption: One-of-a-kind enchanted crossbow of exquisitely detailed craftsmanship. Made to celebrate the matrimonial union, and reconciliation, between the houses of the Erdtree and the Full Moon, Leyndell and Raya Lucaria. The two rings dance when reloading the weapon. Reveals true worth when used with holy-infused bolts.

43080000.name: Arbalest
43080000.caption:
Large crossbow made from composite materials. One of the largest of all bolt-firing devices.

Its limbs are more pliable than metallic ones, allowing bolts fired from this weapon to pierce even helms forged of steel.

43100000.name: Buckshot Crossbow
43100000.caption:
A weapon that combines two crossbows to scatter bolts in a wide arc.

A crude and inaccurate weapon, yet carries considerable might for those who might wield it.

43110000.name: Crepus's Black-Key Crossbow
43110000.caption:
Black crossbow featuring a long stock. Used for sniping, it has a very long range.

Weapon of Crepus, who served the Two Fingers from the shadows of the Roundtable as the head confessor.

44000000.name: Hand Ballista
44000000.caption:
An unconventional ballistic device modelled on a weapon used to besiege castles. Only capable of firing greatbolts.

Perfect for reckless acts such as storming a castle or facing an entire army alone.

44010000.name: Jar Cannon
44010000.caption:
Jar cannon which uses explosives to fire greatbolts. Deals great damage but is slow to reload.

Experimental firearm brought to the assault on Volcano Manor, where it was discovered that no one knew how to use it.

50000000.name: Arrow
50000000.caption:
Arrows used with small and long bows.
Unremarkable in any way, shape or form.

50010000.name: Fire Arrow
50010000.caption:
Arrow with the tip set alight.
Deals fire damage.

50020000.name: Serpent Arrow
50020000.caption:
Arrow carved to resemble a flying snake. Used in tandem with the Serpent Bow.

Loyal minions of the Formless Serpents, their fangs are daubed with deadly poison.

50030000.name: Bone Arrow (Fletched)
50030000.info: Thin, whittled animal bone with feather fletchings
50030000.caption:
Arrow whittled from thin animal bones. Craftable item.

The feather fletching adds distance to the arrow's flight.

50040000.name: St. Trina's Arrow
50040000.caption:
Arrow carved to resemble a withered water lily. Afflicts targets with a powerful sleep effect.

Priests of St. Trina use these arrows to spread their teachings. The sweet oblivion of sleep can become quite the habit.

50060000.name: Shattershard Arrow (Fletched)
50060000.caption:
Arrow whittled from animal bones tipped with a shard of crystal. Creates a resonating noise at the point of impact.

Craftable item. The fletching adds distance to the arrow's flight.

50080000.name: Rainbow Stone Arrow (Fletched)
50080000.caption:
Arrow whittled from animal bones tipped with chips of Rainbow Stone. Colored light shines at the point of impact.

Craftable item. The fletching adds distance to the arrow's flight.

50090000.name: Golden Arrow
50090000.caption:
Carved arrows made in tandem with the Erdtree Bow. Deals holy damage.

Highly effective against Those Who Live in Death, and able to prevent them from rising again.

50100000.name: Dwelling Arrow
50100000.caption:
Arrow in which the spirits of small animals are thought to dwell. 
Deals magic damage.

Used by the master hunters of the ancestral followers.

50110000.name: Bone Arrow
50110000.info: Arrow whittled from thin animal bone
50110000.caption:
Arrow whittled from thin animal bones. Craftable item.

Though the tip is certainly sharp, it does not fly particularly true.

50130000.name: Firebone Arrow (Fletched)
50130000.info: Fletched animal bone arrow set alight when shot
50130000.caption:
Arrow whittled from animal bones. The tip is set alight before firing. Deals fire damage.

Craftable item. The fletching adds distance to the arrow's flight.

50140000.name: Firebone Arrow
50140000.info: Animal bone arrow set alight when shot
50140000.caption:
Arrow whittled from animal bones. The tip is set alight before firing. Deals fire damage.

Craftable item.

50150000.name: Poisonbone Arrow (Fletched)
50150000.info: Fletched animal bone arrow with poison-daubed tip
50150000.caption:
Arrow whittled from animal bones. The tip is daubed with venom. Afflicts targets with poison.

Craftable item. The fletching adds distance to the arrow's flight.

50160000.name: Poisonbone Arrow
50160000.info: Animal bone arrow with poison-daubed tip
50160000.caption:
Arrow whittled from animal bones. The tip is daubed with venom. Afflicts targets with poison.

Craftable item.

50170000.name: Sleepbone Arrow (Fletched)
50170000.info: Fletched animal bone arrow with waterlily tincture tip
50170000.caption:
Arrow whittled from animal bones. The tip is daubed with a water lily tincture. Afflicts targets with sleep.

Craftable item. The fletching adds distance to the arrow's flight.

50180000.name: Sleepbone Arrow
50180000.info: Animal bone arrow with waterlily tincture tip
50180000.caption:
Arrow whittled from animal bones. The tip is daubed with a water lily tincture. Afflicts targets with sleep.

Craftable item.

50190000.name: Stormwing Bone Arrow
50190000.info: Bone arrow fletched with stormhawk feathers
50190000.caption:
Arrow whittled from animal bones fletched with stormhawk feathers. Craftable item.

Flies enshrouded in storm winds, breaking enemy stances and guards with ease.

50200000.name: Lightningbone Arrow (Fletched)
50200000.info: Fletched animal bone arrow charged with lightning
50200000.caption:
Arrow whittled from animal bones with a lightning-infused tip. Deals lightning damage.

Craftable item. The fletching adds distance to the arrow's flight.

50210000.name: Lightningbone Arrow
50210000.info: Animal bone arrow charged with lightning
50210000.caption:
Arrow whittled from animal bones with a lightning-infused tip. Deals lightning damage.

Craftable item.

50220000.name: Rainbow Stone Arrow
50220000.info: Animal bone arrow tipped with Rainbow Stone shard
50220000.caption:
Arrow whittled from animal bones tipped with chips of Rainbow Stone. Colored light shines at the point of impact.

Craftable item.

50230000.name: Shattershard Arrow
50230000.info: Animal bone arrow tipped with crystal shard
50230000.caption:
Arrow whittled from animal bones tipped with a shard of crystal. Creates a resonating noise at the point of impact.

Craftable item.

50240000.name: Spiritflame Arrow
50240000.caption:
Arrow set alight with ghostflame before firing. Deals magic damage while also afflicting foes with frost.

Used by the Company of the Fallen Hawk, once ordered to explore the Eternal City.

50250000.name: Storm Arrow
50250000.info: Animal bone arrow, gust knocks enemies away
50250000.caption:
Animal bone arrow that knocks enemies away with a gust of wind.

Craftable item.

50260000.name: Magicbone Arrow (Fletched)
50260000.info: Fletched bone arrow with glintstone tincture tip
50260000.caption:
Arrow whittled from animal bones. The tip is daubed with a glintstone tincture. Deals magic damage.

Craftable item. The fletching adds distance to the arrow's flight.

50270000.name: Magicbone Arrow
50270000.info: Animal bone arrow with glintstone tincture tip
50270000.caption:
Arrow whittled from animal bones. The tip is daubed with a glintstone tincture. Deals magic damage.

Craftable item.

50280000.name: Haligbone Arrow (Fletched)
50280000.info: Fletched bone arrow with gold tincture tip
50280000.caption:
Arrow whittled from animal bones. The tip is daubed with a golden tincture. Deals holy damage.

Craftable item. The fletching adds distance to the arrow's flight.

50290000.name: Haligbone Arrow
50290000.info: Animal bone arrow with gold tincture tip
50290000.caption:
Arrow whittled from animal bones. The tip is daubed with a golden tincture. Deals holy damage.

Craftable item.

50300000.name: Bloodbone Arrow (Fletched)
50300000.info: Fletched bone arrow with blood tincture tip
50300000.caption:
Arrow whittled from animal bones. The tip is daubed with a blood tincture. Afflicts targets with blood loss.

Craftable item. The fletching adds distance to the arrow's flight.

50310000.name: Bloodbone Arrow
50310000.info: Animal bone arrow with blood tincture tip
50310000.caption:
Arrow whittled from animal bones. The tip is daubed with a blood tincture. Afflicts targets with blood loss.

Craftable item.

50320000.name: Coldbone Arrow (Fletched)
50320000.info: Fletched bone arrow with frozen tip
50320000.caption:
Arrow whittled from animal bones with a frozen tip. Afflicts targets with frost.

Craftable item. The fletching adds distance to the arrow's flight.

50330000.name: Coldbone Arrow
50330000.info: Animal bone arrow with frozen tip
50330000.caption:
Arrow whittled from animal bones with a frozen tip. Afflicts targets with frost.

Craftable item.

50340000.name: Rotbone Arrow (Fletched)
50340000.info: Fletched bone arrow with rot-coated tip
50340000.caption:
Arrow whittled from animal bones. The tip is daubed with rot. Afflicts targets with scarlet rot.

Craftable item. The fletching adds distance to the arrow's flight.

50350000.name: Rotbone Arrow
50350000.info: Animal bone arrow with rot-coated tip
50350000.caption:
Arrow whittled from animal bones. The tip is daubed with rot. Afflicts targets with scarlet rot.

Craftable item.

51000000.name: Great Arrow
51000000.caption: A greatarrow as large as a spear for use with greatbows. Used by archers of monstrous strength employed by a lord's army.

51010000.name: Golem's Great Arrow
51010000.caption:
Greatarrow of black stone crafted by a civilization now gone to ruin. Used by the Guardian Golem.

This hefty arrow is enrobed in tempestuous winds, allowing it to break enemy stances and guards with ease.

51020000.name: Golden Great Arrow
51020000.caption:
Carved greatarrows made together with the Erdtree Greatbow. Deals holy damage.

Imbued with an oath-sworn incantation, which boosts the attack and defense of the archer and their nearby allies.

51030000.name: Golem's Magic Arrow
51030000.caption:
Greatarrow of black stone crafted by a civilization now gone to ruin. Imbued with its ancient magic.

Deals magic damage.

51040000.name: Radahn's Spear
51040000.caption:
Greatarrows used by General Radahn during the festival of combat. These are in fact the many spears with which he was stabbed by the Cleanrot Knights.

Imbued with Radahn's gravitational power.

51050000.name: Bone Great Arrow (Fletched)
51050000.info: Thick, whittled bone arrow with feather fletchings
51050000.caption:
Greatarrow as large as a spear whittled from stout animal bones.

Craftable item. The fletching adds distance to the arrow's flight.

51060000.name: Bone Great Arrow
51060000.info: Thick, whittled animal bone arrow, large as a spear
51060000.caption:
Greatarrow as large as a spear whittled from stout animal bones.

Though the tip is certainly sharp, it does not fly particularly true.

52000000.name: Bolt
52000000.caption:
Ammunition used for crossbows.
A widespread, common type of bolt.

52010000.name: Lightning Bolt
52010000.caption:
Bolt tipped with a shard of Gravel Stone. Deals powerful lightning damage.

Used by worshippers of the ancient dragons.

52020000.name: Perfumer's Bolt
52020000.caption:
Bolt created with perfumer techniques. Used by nobles' guards and the like.

The point of impact explodes with sparks, dealing fire damage.

52030000.name: Black-Key Bolt
52030000.caption:
Bolts used in Crepus' Black-Key Crossbow, an assassin's tool of exquisite craftsmanship.

The intricate spiral tip bores deep, injecting scarlet rot far into the flesh of its target.

52040000.name: Burred Bolt
52040000.caption:
Bolt covered in thorns. One of the most horrific weapons used in the Shattering. Afflicts target with blood loss.

Difficult to remove once buried in flesh, causing appalling damage to the body.

52050000.name: Meteor Bolt
52050000.caption:
Enchanted work of craft made in tandem with the Full Moon Crossbow. The tip is embedded with glintstone.

Like a shooting star, these bolts leave a beautiful trail when fired. Deals magic damage.

52060000.name: Explosive Bolt
52060000.caption: Bolt tipped with a shard of Explosive Stone. Explodes on impact, dealing fire damage.

52070000.name: Golden Bolt
52070000.caption:
Bolt blessed with an incantation of the Erdtree. Deals powerful holy damage.

Once used by guards of the Capital.

52080000.name: Lordsworn's Bolt
52080000.caption:
Well-crafted bolt with an illustrious design, wielded by regulars of a lord's army.

Deals more damage than its commonplace cousin.

52090000.name: Bone Bolt
52090000.caption:
Bolt carved from a thin animal bone. Craftable item.

Though the tip is certainly sharp, it does not fly particularly true.

52100000.name: Firebone Bolt
52100000.info: Animal bone bolt set alight when shot
52100000.caption:
Bolt carved from animal bone. The tip is set alight before firing. Deals fire damage.

Craftable item.

52110000.name: Lightningbone Bolt
52110000.info: Animal bone bolt with lightning-imbued tip
52110000.caption:
Bolt crafted from animal bone with a lightning-infused tip. Deals lightning damage.

Craftable item.

52120000.name: Magicbone Bolt
52120000.info: Animal bone bolt with glintstone tincture tip
52120000.caption:
Bolt carved from animal bone. The tip is daubed with a glintstone tincture. Deals magic damage.

Craftable item.

52130000.name: Haligbone Bolt
52130000.info: Animal bone bolt with gold tincture tip
52130000.caption:
Bolt carved from animal bone. The tip is daubed with a golden tincture. Deals holy damage.

Craftable item.

52140000.name: Poisonbone Bolt
52140000.info: Animal bone bolt with poison-coated tip
52140000.caption:
Bolt carved from animal bone. The tip is daubed with venom. Afflicts targets with poison.

Craftable item.

52150000.name: Bloodbone Bolt
52150000.info: Animal bone bolt with blood tincture tip
52150000.caption:
Bolt carved from animal bone. The tip is daubed with a blood tincture. Afflicts targets with blood loss.

Craftable item.

52160000.name: Coldbone Bolt
52160000.info: Animal bone bolt with frozen tip
52160000.caption:
Bolt carved from animal bone with a frozen tip. Afflicts targets with frost.

Craftable item.

52170000.name: Rotbone Bolt
52170000.info: Animal bone bolt with rot-coated tip
52170000.caption:
Bolt carved from animal bone. The tip is daubed with rot. Afflicts targets with scarlet rot.

Craftable item.

52180000.name: Sleepbone Bolt
52180000.info: Animal bone bolt with waterlily tincture tip
52180000.caption:
Bolt carved from animal bone. The tip is daubed with a waterlily tincture. Afflicts targets with sleep.

Craftable item.

52190000.name: Flaming Bolt
52190000.caption:
Bolt with a fiercely burned tip. Deals powerful fire damage.

Used by survivors of Radahn's army to stave off the scarlet rot.

53000000.name: Ballista Bolt
53000000.caption: Greatbolt as large as a spear for use with Hand Ballista.

53010000.name: Lightning Greatbolt
53010000.caption:
Greatbolt tipped with a clump of Gravel Stone shards.

Deals powerful lightning damage.

53020000.name: Explosive Greatbolt
53020000.caption:
Greatbolt tipped with a clump of Explosive Stone shards.

Detonates a large explosion on impact, dealing fire damage.

53030000.name: Bone Ballista Bolt
53030000.info: Thick, whittled bone bolt, large as a spear
53030000.caption:
Greatbolt as large as a spear carved from stout animal bones. Craftable item.

Though the tip is certainly sharp, it does not fly particularly true.

10000.name: Head
10000.caption: Bare head with no armor equipped.

10100.name: Body
10100.caption: Bare torso with no armor equipped.

10200.name: Arms
10200.caption: Bare arms with no armor equipped.

10300.name: Legs
10300.caption: Bare legs with no armor equipped.

40000.name: Iron Helmet
40000.caption:
An iron helmet showing rust on its edges.

Cloth covering the mouth and neck provides some resistance to poison and other irritants.

40100.name: Scale Armor
40100.info: Armor composed of small metal plates
40100.caption:
Armor reinforced with small metal scales.

The cape covering the shoulders is made with treated rock lizard skin, and provides ample protection against fire.

40300.name: Leather Trousers
40300.caption:
Well-made leather trousers.

The lower legs are each bound in cord for ease of movement.

50000.name: Kaiden Helm
50000.caption:
Helm worn by Kaiden sellswords.

These hulking, fearless mercenaries, said to hail from the mountaintops of the wintry north, are adept at fighting on horseback.
Kaiden is the name of their home settlement.

50100.name: Kaiden Armor
50100.caption:
Armor worn by Kaiden sellswords.
Made with the pelt of a snow-wolf, which protects against the cold.

These hulking, fearless mercenaries, said to hail from the mountaintops of the wintry north, are adept at fighting on horseback.
Kaiden is the name of their home settlement.

50200.name: Kaiden Gauntlets
50200.caption:
Gauntlets worn by Kaiden sellswords.

These hulking, fearless mercenaries, said to hail from the mountaintops of the wintry north, are adept at fighting on horseback.
Kaiden is the name of their home settlement.

50300.name: Kaiden Trousers
50300.caption:
Trousers worn by Kaiden sellswords.

These hulking, fearless mercenaries, said to hail from the mountaintops of the wintry north, are adept at fighting on horseback.
Kaiden is the name of their home settlement.

60000.name: Drake Knight Helm
60000.info: Malformed helm fused with dragon flesh
60000.caption:
Black iron helm worn by drake knights.
Features the spoils of a dragon catch as an emblem of pride as both dragon hunter and partaker of communion.

From birth, drake knights speak not a word. They spend their lives pursuing the strength of dragons, for its sublime beauty and inspiration of awe.

60100.name: Drake Knight Armor
60100.info: Malformed armor fused with dragon flesh
60100.caption:
Black iron armor worn by drake knights.
Features the spoils of a dragon catch as an emblem of pride as both dragon hunter and partaker of communion.

The cape is crafted with dragon wing membrane.

60200.name: Drake Knight Gauntlets
60200.info: Malformed gauntlets fused with dragon flesh
60200.caption:
Black iron gauntlets worn by drake knights.
Features the spoils of a dragon catch as an emblem of pride as both dragon hunter and partaker of communion.

From birth, drake knights speak not a word. They spend their lives pursuing the strength of dragons, for its sublime beauty and inspiration of awe.

60300.name: Drake Knight Greaves
60300.info: Malformed greaves fused with dragon flesh
60300.caption:
Black iron greaves by drake knights.
Features the spoils of a dragon catch as an emblem of pride as both dragon hunter and partaker of communion.

From birth, drake knights speak not a word. They spend their lives pursuing the strength of dragons, for its sublime beauty and inspiration of awe.

61000.name: Drake Knight Helm (Altered)
61000.info: Malformed light helm fused with dragon flesh
61000.caption:
Black iron helm worn by drake knights.
Features the spoils of a dragon catch as an emblem of pride as both dragon hunter and partaker of communion.

From birth, drake knights speak not a word. They spend their lives pursuing the strength of dragons, for its sublime beauty and inspiration of awe.

61100.name: Drake Knight Armor (Altered)
61100.info: Malformed armor fused with dragon flesh
61100.caption:
Black iron armor worn by drake knights.
Features the spoils of a dragon catch as an emblem of pride as both dragon hunter and partaker of communion.

From birth, drake knights speak not a word. They spend their lives pursuing the strength of dragons, for its sublime beauty and inspiration of awe.

80000.name: Scaled Helm
80000.info: Helm made from layered ancient dragon scales
80000.caption:
Helm worn by Old Knight Istvan.
The corroded metal is reinforced with rock-hard scales, making it highly effective against non-physical attacks.

Istvan is one of a few wizened Tarnished who survive to this day.

80100.name: Scaled Armor
80100.info: Armor made from layered ancient dragon scales
80100.caption:
Armor worn by Old Knight Istvan.
The corroded metal is reinforced with rock-hard scales, making it highly effective against non-physical attacks.

Istvan is one of a few wizened Tarnished who survive to this day.

80200.name: Scaled Gauntlets
80200.info: Gauntlets made from layered ancient dragon scales
80200.caption:
Gauntlets worn by Old Knight Istvan.
The corroded metal is reinforced with rock-hard scales, making it highly effective against non-physical attacks.

Istvan is one of a few wizened Tarnished who survive to this day.

80300.name: Scaled Greaves
80300.info: Greaves made from layered ancient dragon scales
80300.caption:
Greaves worn by Old Knight Istvan.
The corroded metal is reinforced with rock-hard scales, making it highly effective against non-physical attacks.

Istvan is one of a few wizened Tarnished who survive to this day.

81100.name: Scaled Armor (Altered)
81100.info: Armor made of layered ancient dragon scales
81100.caption:
Armor worn by Old Knight Istvan.
The corroded metal is reinforced with rock-hard scales, making it highly effective against non-physical attacks.

Istvan is one of a few wizened Tarnished who survive to this day.

90000.name: Perfumer Hood
90000.info: Hood of an Erdtree Capital perfumer
90000.caption:
Hood of an Erdtree Capital perfumer.

In times past, the role of perfumer was much respected; a blessed apothecary in the eyes of the many. But after entering the battlefields of the Shattering they performed no such role, trading their aromatics for poisons and explosives.

90100.name: Perfumer Robe
90100.info: Robe of an Erdtree Capital perfumer
90100.caption:
Robe of an Erdtree Capital perfumer.

The thick front apron embroidered with a depiction of the Erdtree is proof of mastery of the apothecarial arts, and its weight symbolizes the onus of both pride and responsibility.

90200.name: Perfumer Gloves
90200.info: Gloves of an Erdtree Capital perfumer
90200.caption:
Gloves of an Erdtree Capital perfumer.

In times past, the role of perfumer was much respected; a blessed apothecary in the eyes of the many. But after entering the battlefields of the Shattering they performed no such role, trading their aromatics for poisons and explosives.

90300.name: Perfumer Sarong
90300.info: Sarong of an Erdtree Capital perfumer
90300.caption:
Sarong of an Erdtree Capital perfumer.

In times past, the role of perfumer was much respected; a blessed apothecary in the eyes of the many. But after entering the battlefields of the Shattering they performed no such role, trading their aromatics for poisons and explosives.

91100.name: Perfumer Robe (Altered)
91100.info: Tunic of an Erdtree Capital perfumer
91100.caption:
Robe of an Erdtree Capital perfumer.

The thick front apron embroidered with a depiction of the Erdtree is proof of mastery of the apothecarial arts, and its weight symbolizes the onus of both pride and responsibility.

100000.name: Traveler's Hat
100000.info: Leather tricorne of an unaffiliated perfumer
100000.caption:
Hat of a traveling perfumer of no renown.

An associate of a healer, he is said to be in search of new aromatics and flower gardens, in hopes of treating Misbegotten, Omen, and all those seen as impure.

100100.name: Perfumer's Traveling Garb
100100.caption:
Garb of a traveling perfumer of no renown.

The thick front apron, the badge of a perfumer, has been replaced with a more simple one made from soft leather.

100200.name: Traveler's Gloves
100200.caption:
Gloves of a traveling perfumer of no renown.

An associate of a healer, he is said to be in search of new aromatics and flower gardens, in hopes of treating Misbegotten, Omen, and all those seen as impure.

100300.name: Traveler's Slops
100300.caption:
Slops of a traveling perfumer of no renown.

An associate of a healer, he is said to be in search of new aromatics and flower gardens, in hopes of treating Misbegotten, Omen, and all those seen as impure.

101100.name: Perfumer's Traveling Garb (Altered)
101100.caption:
Garb of a traveling perfumer of no renown.

The thick front apron, the badge of a perfumer, has been replaced with a more simple one made from soft leather.

120000.name: Alberich's Pointed Hat
120000.info: Hat of a defected glintstone sorcerer
120000.caption:
Mad Tongue Alberich's pointed hat, a sign of a heretical practitioner.

Set with red glintstones, said to be formed by the blood of sacrifices. Strengthens thorn sorcery.

Alberich was an aloof yet disturbed heretical sorcerer said to have been driven mad by jeering tongues during his service to the Roundtable Hold long ago.

120100.name: Alberich's Robe
120100.info: Robe of a defected glintstone sorcerer
120100.caption:
Mad Tongue Alberich's robe.

Set with red glintstones, said to be formed by the blood of sacrifices. Strengthens thorn sorcery.

Alberich was an aloof yet disturbed heretical sorcerer said to have been driven mad by jeering tongues during his service to the Roundtable Hold long ago.

120200.name: Alberich's Bracers
120200.info: Gloves of a defected glintstone sorcerer
120200.caption:
Mad Tongue Alberich's bracers.

Set with red glintstones, said to be formed by the blood of sacrifices. Strengthen thorn sorcery.

Alberich was an aloof yet disturbed heretical sorcerer said to have been driven mad by jeering tongues during his service to the Roundtable Hold long ago.

120300.name: Alberich's Trousers
120300.info: Boots of a defected glintstone sorcerer
120300.caption:
Mad Tongue Alberich's trousers.

Alberich was an aloof yet disturbed heretical sorcerer said to have been driven mad by jeering tongues during his service to the Roundtable Hold long ago.

121000.name: Alberich's Pointed Hat (Altered)
121000.info: Cowl of a defected glintstone sorcerer
121000.caption:
Mad Tongue Alberich's pointed hat, a sign of a heretical practitioner.

Set with red glintstones, said to be formed by the blood of sacrifices. Strengthens thorn sorcery.

Alberich was an aloof yet disturbed heretical sorcerer said to have been driven mad by jeering tongues during his service to the Roundtable Hold long ago.

121100.name: Alberich's Robe (Altered)

121100.caption:

130000.name: Spellblade's Pointed Hat
130000.caption:
Glintstone sorcerer Rogier's pointed hat, a sign of a heretical practitioner. Strengthens glintstone sorcery skills.

Rogier spent his entire life behaving with utter detachment. No one noticed the anger, grief, regret, or fear that existed along with it.

130100.name: Spellblade's Traveling Attire
130100.caption:
Glintstone sorcerer Rogier's traveling attire, graced with an intricate, aristocratic decoration. Strengthens glintstone sorcery skills.

Rogier spent his entire life behaving with utter detachment. No one noticed the anger, grief, regret, or fear that existed along with it.

140000.name: Bull-Goat Helm
140000.caption:
Great Horned Tragoth's helm, adorned with a gold bull-goat motif. Provides high poise.

Tragoth is a famed knight of assistance. Countless Tarnished, facing adversity in the Lands Between, have survived thanks only to the Great Horned One's aid.

140100.name: Bull-Goat Armor
140100.caption:
Great Horned Tragoth's armor. Covers its wearer with a pair of giant horns, providing staunch poise.

Tragoth is a famed knight of assistance. Countless Tarnished, facing adversity in the Lands Between, have survived thanks only to the Great Horned One's aid.

140200.caption:

150000.name: Iron Kasa
150000.caption:
Iron kasa of the man who calls himself Shabriri.
Crafted to imitate the woven straw hats worn in the Land of Reeds.

The man, once known as Yura, kept a woman in the deepest reaches of his heart.

150100.name: Ronin's Armor
150100.caption:
Armor of the man who calls himself Shabriri.
Highly functional and heavily worn.

The man, once known as Yura, kept a woman in the deepest reaches of his heart.

150200.name: Ronin's Gauntlets
150200.caption:
Gauntlets of the man who calls himself Shabriri.
Highly functional and heavily worn.

160000.name: Guilty Hood
160000.info: Coarse hooded cloak of olive brown
160000.caption:
Coarse hooded cloak of olive brown.

The garb of those accused of lesser crimes, indicated by the collar of sharpened branches.

160100.name: Cloth Garb
160100.caption: Clothing made of coarse material, commonly worn in the Lands Between.

160200.name: Tarnished Wrap
160200.info: Arm wraps made of rough material
160200.caption:
Arm wraps made of coarse material.
Garb of spurned Tarnished who were
forced into slavery in the Lands Between.

160300.name: Cloth Trousers
160300.caption: Trousers made of coarse material, commonly worn in the Lands Between.

170000.name: Black Wolf Mask
170000.info: Helm made with the head of an old wolf
170000.caption:
A mask fashioned after the head of a black wolf.

Relic of an assassin who assumed the guise of Ranni the Witch's loyal shadow. The likeness is striking.

170100.name: Blaidd's Armor
170100.info: Armor of Blaidd, Knight of Ranni
170100.caption:
Well-worn black armor of the man-wolf Blaidd.

The pelt serves as a cape, protecting from cold.
Blaidd was the blade of Ranni, but the cold bothered him anyway.

170200.name: Blaidd's Gauntlets
170200.info: Gauntlets of Blaidd, Knight of Ranni
170200.caption:
Well-worn black gauntlets of the man-wolf Blaidd.

Blaidd, who served as Ranni's shadow, was a loyal ally who would defy destiny itself if it would have him turn upon his Lady.

170300.name: Blaidd's Greaves
170300.info: Greaves of Blaidd, Knight of Ranni
170300.caption:
Well-worn black greaves of the man-wolf Blaidd.

Blaidd, who served as Ranni's shadow, was a loyal ally who would defy destiny itself if it would have him turn upon his Lady.

171100.caption:

Blaidd, who served as Ranni's shadow, was a loyal ally who would defy destiny itself if it would have him turn upon his Lady.

180000.name: Black Knife Hood
180000.info: Hood used by the Black Blade Assassins
180000.caption:
Hood used by the Black Knife Assassins.

The assassins that carried out the deeds of the Night of the Black Knives were all women, and rumored to be Numen who had close ties with Marika herself.

180100.name: Black Knife Armor
180100.info: Armor used by the Black Blade Assassins
180100.caption:
Scale armor used by the Black Knife Assassins, forged to make no sound.

Traces of power yet remain in its concealing veil, which muffles the sound of footsteps.

The assassins that carried out the deeds of the Night of the Black Knives were all women, and rumored to be Numen who had close ties with Marika herself.

180200.name: Black Knife Gauntlets
180200.info: Gauntlets used by the Black Blade Assassins
180200.caption:

Crafted with scale armor that makes no sound.

The assassins that carried out the deeds of the Night of the Black Knives were all women, and rumored to be Numen who had close ties with Marika herself.

190000.name: Exile Hood
190000.info: Deep red hood that covers the whole head
190000.caption:
Deep red hood that covers the whole head.

Worn by soldiers sent to the penal colonies, who were required to keep their faces hidden.

190100.name: Exile Armor
190100.info: Worn body armor, wrapped in a great cloth
190100.caption:
Damaged armor draped with a large deep-red cloth.
Worn by soldiers sent to the penal colonies.

190200.name: Exile Gauntlets
190200.info: Iron gauntlets worn by salt winds and battle
190200.caption:
Damaged iron gauntlets.
Worn by soldiers sent to the penal colonies.

190300.name: Exile Greaves
190300.info: Iron greaves worn by salt winds and battle
190300.caption:
Damaged iron greaves.
Worn by soldiers sent to the penal colonies.

200000.name: Banished Knight Helm
200000.info: Knight's helm covered in a long cloth of deep red
200000.caption:
Thick, full set of armor covering the entire body.
This helm was worn by knights who, whether by misfortune or misdeed, were forced to abandon their homes.

Perhaps the deep-red scarf was used to block the winds, for on the outskirts, the winds bite with a stinging fierceness.

200100.name: Banished Knight Armor
200100.info: Knight's armor, worn by salt winds and battle
200100.caption:
Thick, full set of armor covering the entire body.
This armor was worn by knights who, whether by misfortune or misdeed, were forced to abandon their homes.

These fierce warriors were each and all accomplished. Perhaps that is why, despite their territorial losses, they were still named knights.

200200.name: Banished Knight Gauntlets
200200.info: Knight's gauntlets, worn by salt winds and battle
200200.caption:
Thick, full set of armor covering the entire body.

These fierce warriors were each and all accomplished. Perhaps that is why, despite their territorial losses, they were still named knights.

210000.name: Briar Helm
210000.caption:
Battered iron helm from a foreign land.
Worn by Elemer of the Briar.

The winding, rusted iron briars are a mark of the guilty, and typically indicate a sentence of death.
Elemer murdered numerous instructors and merchants, and was known as the Bell Bearing Hunter.

210100.caption:

220000.name: Page Hood
220000.caption:
Hood worn by pages who serve the nobility and are mindful to keep them out of harm's way.

The unassuming sack-like appearance befits their unseen and unknown stature.

220100.name: Page Garb
220100.caption:
Garb worn by pages who serve the nobility and are mindful to keep them out of harm's way.

Traveling wear tailored with exquisite precision, to avoid any undue shame for the page's master.

220300.name: Page Trousers
220300.caption:
Trousers worn by pages who serve the nobility and are mindful to keep them out of harm's way.

Traveling wear tailored with exquisite precision, to avoid any undue shame for the page's master.

230000.caption:
Pitch-black helm with flowing black hair.
Worn by the Night's Cavalry who ride funeral steeds.

The Night's Cavalry, who now wander the dim roads of night, were once led by the Fell Omen and were deliverers of death for great warriors, knights, and champions.

230100.name: Night's Cavalry Armor
230100.caption:
Pitch-black armor thinly painted with dried blood.
Worn by the Night's Cavalry who ride funeral steeds.

The Night's Cavalry, who now wander the dim roads of night, were once led by the Fell Omen and were deliverers of death for great warriors, knights, and champions.

240000.name: Blue Silver Mail Hood
240000.info: Chainmail hood made of motherly silver
240000.caption:
Chainmail hood crafted with blue silver.
Worn by the wolf-riding Albinauric archers.

Blue silver is a metal born from the same mother as the archers themselves, and provides protection from magic and frost.

240100.name: Blue Silver Mail Armor
240100.info: Chainmail armor made of motherly silver
240100.caption:
Chainmail armor crafted with blue silver.
Worn by the wolf-riding Albinauric archers.

Blue silver is a metal born from the same mother as the archers themselves, and provides protection from magic and frost.

250000.name: Nomadic Merchant's Chapeau
250000.caption:
Chapeau of the nomadic merchants.
Decorated with tiny gems in a wide spectrum of colors.

These merchants once thrived as the Great Caravan, but after being accused of heretical beliefs, their entire clan was rounded up and buried alive far underground.

Then, they chanted a curse of despair, and summoned the flame of frenzy.

250100.name: Nomadic Merchant's Finery
250100.caption:
Finery of the nomadic merchants.
Decorated with tiny gems in a wide spectrum of colors.

These merchants once thrived as the Great Caravan, but after being accused of heretical beliefs, their entire clan was rounded up and buried alive far underground.

Then, they chanted a curse of despair, and summoned the flame of frenzy.

250300.name: Nomadic Merchant's Trousers

These merchants once thrived as the Great Caravan, but after being accused of heretical beliefs, their entire clan was rounded up and buried alive far underground.

Then, they chanted a curse of despair, and summoned the flame of frenzy.

260000.name: Malformed Dragon Helm
260000.info: Malformed, golden helm used by Gnarrl
260000.caption:
A malformed golden helm.
Adorned with various dragon imagery and worn by the misshapen Tree Sentinels.

After the great ancient dragon Gransax attacked, the sentinels had an epiphany. The only way to truly protect the Erdtree was to become dragons themselves.

260100.name: Malformed Dragon Armor
260100.info: Malformed, golden armor used by Gnarrl
260100.caption:
Malformed golden armor.
Adorned with various dragon imagery and worn by the misshapen Tree Sentinels.

After the great ancient dragon Gransax attacked, the sentinels had an epiphany. The only way to truly protect the Erdtree was to become dragons themselves.

Adorned with various dragon imagery and worn by the misshapen Tree Sentinels.

After the great ancient dragon Gransax attacked, the sentinels had an epiphany. The only way to truly protect the Erdtree was to become dragons themselves.

270000.name: Tree Sentinel Helm
270000.caption:
Golden helm of the heavy cavalry Tree Sentinels who serve the Erdtree.

Very few are permitted to wear a golden wood crest of such size as seen on this helm.

270100.name: Tree Sentinel Armor
270100.caption:
Golden armor of the heavy cavalry Tree Sentinels who serve the Erdtree.

Adorned with a cape featuring the mark of the sacred tree.

Imposingly sturdy and nigh unbreakable, the grace of old yet lingers.

270200.name: Tree Sentinel Gauntlets
270200.caption:
Golden gauntlets of the heavy cavalry Tree Sentinels who serve the Erdtree.

Imposingly sturdy and nigh unbreakable, the grace of old yet lingers.

270300.name: Tree Sentinel Greaves
270300.caption:
Golden greaves of the heavy cavalry Tree Sentinels who serve the Erdtree.

Imposingly sturdy and nigh unbreakable, the grace of old yet lingers.

271100.caption:
Golden armor of the heavy cavalry Tree Sentinels who serve the Erdtree.

Imposingly sturdy and nigh unbreakable, the grace of old yet lingers.

280000.name: Royal Knight Helm
280000.caption:
Silver helm of Loretta, a knight who served Miquella's Haligtree.

Loretta, once a royal Carian knight, went on a journey in search of a haven for Albinaurics, and determined that the Haligtree was their best chance for eventual salvation.

280100.name: Royal Knight Armor
280100.caption:
Silver armor of Loretta, a knight who served Miquella's Haligtree.

Loretta was once a royal Carian knight, and her lapis-lazuli blue cape is the emblem of the knightly pride that continues to guide her.

280200.name: Royal Knight Gauntlets
280200.caption:
Silver gauntlets of Loretta, a knight who served Miquella's Haligtree.

Loretta, once a royal Carian knight, went on a journey in search of a haven for Albinaurics, and determined that the Haligtree was their best chance for eventual salvation.

280300.name: Royal Knight Greaves
280300.caption:
Silver greaves of Loretta, a knight who served Miquella's Haligtree.

Loretta, once a royal Carian knight, went on a journey in search of a haven for Albinaurics, and determined that the Haligtree was their best chance for eventual salvation.

281100.caption:

Loretta, once a royal Carian knight, went on a journey in search of a haven for Albinaurics, and determined that the Haligtree was their best chance for eventual salvation.

290000.name: Nox Monk Hood
290000.info: Hood worn by members of the Empyrean family
290000.caption:
Silk hood worn by the monks of the Eternal City.

Long ago, the Nox invoked the ire of the Greater Will, and were banished deep underground. Now they live under a false night sky, in eternal anticipation of their liege. Of the coming age of the stars. And their Lord of Night.

290100.name: Nox Monk Armor
290100.info: Armor worn by members of the Empyrean family
290100.caption:
Armor worn by the monks of the Eternal City, with a silk cape attached.

Long ago, the Nox invoked the ire of the Greater Will, and were banished deep underground. Now they live under a false night sky, in eternal anticipation of their liege. Of the coming age of the stars. And their Lord of Night.

290200.name: Nox Monk Bracelets
290200.info: Bracelets worn by members of the Empyrean family
290200.caption:
Bracelets worn by the monks of the Eternal City.

Long ago, the Nox invoked the ire of the Greater Will, and were banished deep underground. Now they live under a false night sky, in eternal anticipation of their liege. Of the coming age of the stars. And their Lord of Night.

290300.name: Nox Monk Greaves

290300.caption:

292000.name: Nox Swordstress Crown
292000.info: Crown worn by members of the Empyrean family
292000.caption:
Crown worn by swordstresses of the Eternal City.
These women are the personal guards of the nightmaidens, and the silk hides their eyes.

Long ago, the Nox invoked the ire of the Greater Will, and were banished deep underground. Now they live under a false night sky, in eternal anticipation of their liege. Of the coming age of the stars. And their Lord of Night.

293000.caption:
Twin crowns worn by the nightmaidens of the Eternal City.
Indicates the highest clerical rank, and hides the eyes with silk.

Long ago, the Nox invoked the ire of the Greater Will, and were banished deep underground. Now they live under a false night sky, in eternal anticipation of their liege. Of the coming age of the stars. And their Lord of Night.

293100.caption:
Armor worn by the nightmaidens of the Eternal City.
Indicates the highest clerical rank, and includes a silk cape.

Long ago, the Nox invoked the ire of the Greater Will, and were banished deep underground. Now they live under a false night sky, in eternal anticipation of their liege. Of the coming age of the stars. And their Lord of Night.

294000.caption:
Crown worn by swordstresses of the Eternal City.
The silk eye covering is removed, flaunting convention.

Long ago, the Nox invoked the ire of the Greater Will, and were banished deep underground. Now they live under a false night sky, in eternal anticipation of their liege. Of the coming age of the stars. And their Lord of Night.

294100.caption:

These women are the personal guards of the nightmaidens.

Long ago, the Nox invoked the ire of the Greater Will, and were banished deep underground. Now they live under a false night sky, in eternal anticipation of their liege. Of the coming age of the stars. And their Lord of Night.

300000.name: Great Horned Headband
300000.info: Headband worn by worshippers of stag specters
300000.caption:
Headband decorated by a pair of great horns.
Worn by ancestral follower warriors.

The ancestral followers keep their distance from the Erdtree, awaiting new buds. They are certain to sprout from their very flesh, and indeed, their souls.

300100.name: Fur Raiment
300100.info: Garb worn by worshippers of stag specters
300100.caption:
Raiment fashioned from a bristly pelt.
Worn by ancestral follower warriors.

The ancestral followers keep their distance from the Erdtree, awaiting new buds. They are certain to sprout from their very flesh, and indeed, their souls.

300300.name: Fur Leggings
300300.info: Leggings worn by worshippers of stag specters
300300.caption:
Leggings fashioned from bristly pelts.
Worn by ancestral follower warriors.

The ancestral followers keep their distance from the Erdtree, awaiting new buds. They are certain to sprout from their very flesh, and indeed, their souls.

301000.name: Shining Horned Headband
301000.caption:
Headband decorated by a pair of shining horns.
Worn by ancestral follower shamans.

Horns with buds that also shine are ideal ceremonial items for ancestral worship. Strengthens Ancestral Infant's Head.

301100.name: Shaman Furs
301100.caption:
Raiment fashioned from a bristly pelt.
Worn by ancestral follower shamans.

The ancestral followers live a distance from the Erdtree, awaiting new buds. They are certain to sprout from their very flesh, and indeed, their souls.

301300.name: Shaman Leggings
301300.caption:
Leggings fashioned from bristly pelts.
Worn by ancestral follower shamans.

The ancestral followers live a distance from the Erdtree, awaiting new buds. They are certain to sprout from their very flesh, and indeed, their souls.

310000.name: Duelist Helm
310000.info: Bronze helm adorned with many snakes
310000.caption:
Bronze helm decorated with innumerable snakes.
Worn by gladiators who were driven from the colosseum. The wearer becomes a slightly easier target for foes.

The snake is viewed as a traitor to the Erdtree, and the audience delighted in seeing these bronze effigies beaten and battered.

310100.name: Gravekeeper Cloak
310100.info: Robe made from a beast pelt
310100.caption:
Thick, bristly cloak that is the symbol of an underground gravekeeper.

Those who once fought for a living were driven from the colosseum, and becoming guardians of Erdtree Burial.

310300.name: Duelist Greaves
310300.caption:
Greaves encircled by bronze snakes.
Worn by gladiators who were driven from the colosseum. The wearer becomes a slightly easier target for foes.

The snake is viewed as a traitor to the Erdtree, and the audience delighted in seeing these bronze effigies beaten and battered.

311100.name: Gravekeeper Cloak (Altered)
311100.caption:
Defensive wear encircled by bronze snakes.
Worn by gladiators who were driven from the colosseum. The wearer becomes a slightly easier target for foes.

The snake is viewed as a traitor to the Erdtree, and the audience delighted in seeing these bronze effigies beaten and battered.

320000.name: Sanguine Noble Hood
320000.info: Hood of dyed black cloth featuring gold embroidery
320000.caption:
Hood of dyed black cloth featuring gold embroidery.
Worn by the nobles who serve the Lord of Blood.

Known to strike from pools of blood, these assassins are missionaries come to share the gospel of accursed blood.

320100.name: Sanguine Noble Robe
320100.info: Robe of dyed black cloth featuring gold embroidery
320100.caption:
Robe of dyed black cloth featuring gold embroidery.
Worn by the nobles who serve the Lord of Blood.

The grand metallic pattern on the shoulder is a signifier of the noble rank they intend to claim upon the advent of the new dynasty they are working to install.

320300.name: Sanguine Noble Waistcloth
320300.caption:
Waistcloth sewn from black cloth.
Worn by the nobles who serve the Lord of Blood.

Known to strike from pools of blood, these assassins are missionaries come to share the gospel of accursed blood.

330000.name: Guardian Mask
330000.info: Mask worn by the people of rotted abundance
330000.caption:
Engraved golden mask.
Worn by the guardians of the Minor Erdtrees.

In accordance with an ancient pact with the Erdtree, it is said that their deaths led not to destruction, but instead to renewed, eternal life as guardians.

330100.name: Guardian Garb (Full Bloom)
330100.info: Armor worn by the people of rotted abundance
330100.caption:
Engraved golden garb.
Worn by the guardians of the Minor Erdtrees.

Raises the HP recovery effects of the Flask of Crimson Tears, but greatly lowers fire damage negation.

It is said that the blood-red flowers blooming on their backs mark the senescence of their ancient pact. Perhaps the guardians are part tree already.

330200.name: Guardian Bracers
330200.info: Gauntlets worn by the people of rotted abundance
330200.caption:
Engraved golden bracers.
Worn by the guardians of the Minor Erdtrees.

In accordance with an ancient pact with the Erdtree, it is said that their deaths led not to destruction, but instead to renewed, eternal life as guardians.

330300.name: Guardian Greaves
330300.info: Greaves worn by the people of rotted abundance
330300.caption:
Engraved golden greaves.
Worn by the guardians of the Minor Erdtrees.

In accordance with an ancient pact with the Erdtree, it is said that their deaths led not to destruction, but instead to renewed, eternal life as guardians.

331100.name: Guardian Garb
331100.info: Vest worn by the people of rotted abundance
331100.caption:
Engraved golden garb.
Worn by the guardians of the Minor Erdtrees.

In accordance with an ancient pact with the Erdtree, it is said that their deaths led not to destruction, but instead to renewed, eternal life as guardians.

340000.name: Cleanrot Helm
340000.info: Helm of a Wing Knight. Somewhat decayed...
340000.caption:
Winged helm of the Cleanrot Knights, celebrated for their undefeated campaign in the Shattering.

The Cleanrot Knights vowed to fight alongside Malenia, despite the inevitable, if gradual, putrefaction of their flesh. Their acceptance of their fate made these battles the fiercest of all.

340100.name: Cleanrot Armor
340100.info: Armor of a Wing Knight. Somewhat decayed...
340100.caption:
Armor of the Cleanrot Knights, celebrated for their undefeated campaign in the Shattering.

The Cleanrot Knights vowed to fight alongside Malenia, despite the inevitable, if gradual, putrefaction of their flesh. Their acceptance of their fate made these battles the fiercest of all.

340300.caption:
